intro: Pasania mairei, commonly known as the Maire’s pasania, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland forest environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and leathery, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
